STBLKeyStringList.Text: Each artist is merely one member of an ever-evolving legacy of artists that have come before them, and this variety of sketches and studies showcases this never-ending legacy.
Sketches and Studies of Studies

The CreativePro Tablet puts all the dynamic tools and mediums of a professional artist in the palm of your hand! It features a sleek travel case and tons of battery life, so who knows where your art will take you (or where you will take it!).
The CreativePro Tablet
This light is perfect for when you need that perfect angle of light for your next still life or portrait painting. Your next masterpiece is only a set of brush strokes away!
Industrial Spotlight

With The Rolling Easel, you have the flexibility and storage space for all your artistic needs. With a built-in drawer and storage shelf, you're fully equipped to zone out and paint endlessly for hours... or days.
The Rolling Easel by Independent Expressions Inc.

When creating art and perfecting your craft, sometimes the unexpected objects are the most interesting. Use this thrown-together display to make your own still-life creations! Will you paint an arrangement of stunning plants, bowls of fruits, or perhaps some gemstones? The possibilities are endless!
Improvised Studio Pedestal
When the artist is at work, no surface is safe from haphazardly placed brushes, palettes, and that scrupulous cup of dirty paint water. DO NOT mistake the dirty water for your cup of tea...
"Anything's a Surface" Pedestal
These splatters may have been unplanned, but what do you see? A face, a shape? Is it accidental or a message from the universe?
Accidental Paint Splatters
Drapery is an iconic part of classical and fine art. Use this backdrop for a still life, or pose your family in front of it to paint the perfect family portrait!
Studio Drape Backdrop

Why are they discounted, you may ask? Well, you went to the hardware store and stumbled upon an impressive set of unwanted paints at an exceptional price. Naturally, you took advantage of the deal. Then, you came home, only to realize the unending buckets of paint already in your studio. Still, you saved some money! So, the cycle continues as you tell yourself you'll make use of them someday...
Discounted Paint Cans

The artist who created this masterpiece went to great lengths. They learned the fundamental steps to creating a masterpiece: first, the artist visualized their concept before embracing the marble, washing the marble, and then becoming the marble!
Torso in Repose

When you have this many brushes, you'll use anything for storage. Is it an excuse to hold on to that sentimental mug that you couldn't let go of? Maybe! But at least it's a sustainable and warm reminder of precious memories.
Odds and Ends Brush Storage
A pile of sketchbooks like this encapsulates an artist's complete body of work. To some, this stack is more than its weight in gold!
Collection of Sketchbooks

An excerpt from Classical Images in Art:\n"The forlorn pitcher, accompanied by a bounty of fruits, turns away and opposes its very existence. Why is it forlorn, and why does this image continue to haunt artists? We're unsure, but that pitcher's bombastic side eye captivated the world."
The Forlorn Pitcher

Ah, the lily—a potent and symbolic image in many cultures. How will you choose to represent it in your work? Will it be fresh, fragrant, and lush to comment on the beauty of nature, or will you pursue its dried and withering counterpart to reflect on the essence of life itself?
Lilium Mortem
Is it weird to think these little paint tubes cost exorbitantly more than the palettes themselves?
Painter's Palettes

Stow away your possessions and favorite hoodie to keep them free of paint splatters and accidental spills because art is inevitably messy. Did you really have to hang a paint can from the ceiling and let it drip everywhere? Of course you did!
Pollock's Storage Locker

For all your creativity needs, look no further than the "Ready, Set, Gogh!" Cart! This rolling cart is built with industrial steel and metal casters for durability and sturdiness. With enough storage space for bins, paints, brushes, and more, you'll have all you need to create a work of art without ever stepping away from your easel.
"Ready, Set, Gogh!" Cart

Nothing says "you're a professional artist" more than this cabinet! It has everything you need to store your treasured supplies, including rows of paper and canvas storage, small drawers for paint tubes, and a stylish glass panel.
The Companion Cabinet by .ECT

Do you need more space in your art studio? Why not use a step ladder up? Those steps may have been meant for something other than your sketchbooks and art supplies, but they do the job. After all, isn't creative solutions what art is all about?
The Step-Ladder Shelf

Like a trusted companion, this storage cabinet will dry your precious works of art and supply new canvases for your next great masterpiece. It even holds everything else in between! It's genuinely a "catch-all", yet you'll soon find it essential.
The Rolling Drying Rack
Who doesn't love storage? This cabinet is no exception! It is filled to the brim with paints, brushes, and even a well-loved artist's smock.
Storage Savy Smock Rack

First encountered in the school art room, this sink continues to be a staple for the duration of an artist's life. No matter the place or time, one will always find a set of unwashed brushes, a trash can overflowing with scrapped drawings, and an inevitably clogged sink. This sink is notorious and ever-present... perhaps it should be placed on a pedestal in an art gallery now?
The Notorious Slop Sink
From the brand that brought you the original, KraftMatic Woodworking Table 2.0 delivers an exceptional workspace for all your woodworking needs.
KraftMatic Woodworking Table 2.0
The Artist's Studio
"Down to the Studs" Wall
